name: width
content:

B2 [ C or U ] the distance across something from one side to the other: It is five metres in width. The needle is seven times smaller than the width of a human hair. The material is available in various widths. See also
wide
[ C ] the distance across a swimming pool from one side to the other: I managed to swim two widths underwater.
More examplesFewer examplesThe area of a rectangle is its height times its width.We need to measure the width of the wood.The wood comes in many different widths.The width of the river at this point is quite amazing.How can you measure the width of these tiny wires?
